name: "Dead Like Me"- Daisy Quiz | Dead Like Me | 10 Questions

questions.text: Daisy first appears after this Reaper leaves Rube's crew.
questions.explanation:
Betty Rhomer.

	Betty Rhomer died in 1926 after jumping off a very high cliff, not realizing the height could be fatal. She is very lively, and takes pictures of everyone she has Reaped.

questions.text: Annoyed at Mason's flirting, Daisy pours a drink on him. What drink is it?
questions.explanation:
Soda.

	When she first appears, Daisy orders a Coke with chipped ice. She doesn't get a chance to enjoy it though, as Mason peeves her so much that she pours her soft drink all over his lap.

questions.text: In season one, which other Reaper does Daisy move in with?
questions.explanation:
George Lass.

	Much to George's disappointment, Daisy moves in with her. She proceeds to take over the bed, and she and George clash many times. They eventually move out of George's apartment and move into Mason's house.

questions.text: Daisy claims to have had sexual exploits with many movie stars and celebrities. Among the choices, whom does she NOT mention?
questions.explanation:
Marilyn Monroe.

	Daisy frequently tells the other Reapers about her sexual escapades with Babe Ruth, Errol Flynn, Sir Alec Guinness, Cary Grant, and others. However, Marilyn Monroe is never mentioned.

False.

	Daisy is a blonde, although she doesn't fit the dumb blonde stereotype, thank goodness!

questions.text: What was Daisy's last living thought before she died?
questions.correct: "Why has no one ever loved me?"
questions.explanation:
"Why has no one ever loved me?".

	When the Reapers are doing paperwork, Mason sees Daisy's last thought before she dies: "Why has no one ever loved me?" According to the episode, many people's last thoughts are regrets.

questions.text: Before she joined Rube's crew, where had Daisy been working as a Reaper?
questions.explanation:
New York City.

	Specifically, Daisy had been working in the SoHo district of New York City. It's implied by Rube that she left under less-than-honorable reasons.

"Daisy, Daisy Adair."

	When Daisy is first seen in episode 6, she introduces herself with the line "Daisy, Daisy Adair".  Her sometimes annoying southern charm puts off George and Roxy.

questions.text: What does Daisy classify herself as when the Reapers are completing their self-evaluation forms?
questions.explanation:
She's an actress.

	"I am an actress." Daisy proudly proclaims towards the end of the self-evaluation all Reapers take. In the episode, Rube woke up his crew early just so they could evaluate themselves. Needless to say, this was not a popular move.

questions.text: In the second season, Daisy is stalked by a creature. What creature was it, and what did Daisy name it?
questions.explanation:
A graveling named Ray.

	Ray the graveling was created when Mason killed Ray Summers, a reality TV show executive who was dating Daisy. Ray the graveling was killed when George touched him just as she would touch a Reap.
